title: CC Sabathia leaves Yankees game vs. Astros with injury in possible final career appearance
text:
CLOSE

NEW YORK — We may have seen the last pitches of CC Sabathia's illustrious career.

He exited the game in the top of the eighth with the bases loaded after suffering an apparent arm injury during a two-out at-bat. He threw a warm up pitch, but then walked off with an athletic trainer.

"CC! CC! CC!" the crowd chanted as he perhaps left the Yankee Stadium field for the last time.

With the Yankees down 7-3, Sabathia was facing George Springer.

It seemed unclear exactly what the injury was, but Thursday may have marked the final time Sabathia plays for the Yankees.

Justin Toscano is the Mets beat writer for NorthJersey.com. For unlimited access to all Mets analysis, news, trades and more, please subscribe today and download our app.

Email: toscanoj@northjersey.com Twitter: @justinctoscano
description: In what was possibly his final appearance in his storied career, CC Sabathia left the Yankees' ALCS Game 4 with an injury.
